unit: Unit 7 | Inference for Quantitative Data: Means
title: Pint Size?
question_text: A verified $95\%$ confidence interval showed that the difference between the weights of two different pints of ice cream brands was $(-0.13, 0.21)$ ounces. Describe what this confidence interval is saying.

choices.text: We are $95\%$ sure that one brand of ice cream weighs $0.21$ ounces more than the other brand.
Based on the samples of ice cream, we can be $95\%$ confident that the difference in weights of the pint-sized ice cream brands is between $-0.13$ and $0.21$ ounces.
There is a $95\%$ probability that one brand of ice cream weighs more than the other one.
We are $95\%$ confident that all of the samples taken will have a a difference of means between $-0.13$ and $0.21$ ounces.

Based on the samples of ice cream, we can be 90%
confident that the difference in weights of the pint-sized ice cream brands is between −0.13
and 0.21
ounces.

solution:
Solution

There are two common ways to define a confidence interval using its confidence level. Note that the context and measures of the problem should always be used.

One way to define the confidence interval in this problem would be to say that in repeated random sampling with the same sample sizes, approximately 95%
of confidence intervals created will capture the mean difference in weights of the two brands of ice cream.

The other way would be to say that based on the samples of ice cream, we can be 95%
confident that the difference in weights of the pint-sized ice cream brands is between −0.13
and 0.21
ounces.

So, Choice 'B' is correct.

Explanation of Distractors

Choice 'A' is incorrect because only one end of the interval is used, not the entire interval.

Choice 'C' is incorrect because we are not looking for such a probability and we are comparing the difference in weights, not whether one weighs more than the other.

Choice 'D' is incorrect because this sentence doesn't quite make sense!

Choice 'E' is incorrect because a confidence level of
90
%
is stated rather than the given
95
%
.
